What I did: Created email service with Nodemailer, notification templates (admin, customer confirmation, status updates), and lifecycle hooks for automated email triggers on order creation/status updates
What problem this solves: Automates order communication to partners and internal staff

What I did: Added SMTP configuration, Gmail setup documentation, environment variables in .env.example, and comprehensive error handling
What problem this solves: Provides reliable email delivery infrastructure

What I did: 31 unit tests passing (11 for email service and 20 for templates)
What problem this solves: Ensures email system reliability and prevents regressions

What I did: 6 frontend components (wizard, photo grid, selectors), state management stores (customization, auth with logo upload)
What problem this solves: Enables partners to customize products with their branding

What I did: Backend schema updates, batch submission endpoint, order inquiry number auto-generation (INQ-YYYYMMDD-XXXX)
What problem this solves: Supports customization data storage and unique order tracking

What I did: Designed improved ordering experience: Add to Cart, Order Directly, Order Confirmation, and Checkout Flow features
What problem this solves: Increases order volume and provides faster checkout for partners

What I did: Tested email notification system and discovered customer details appearing blank in emails, documented root cause and solutions
What problem this solves: Identifies issue where staff need to manually look up customer info

What I did: Created comprehensive documentation for email issue: testing performed, problem location, proposed solutions, and next steps
What problem this solves: Enables quick resolution of email customer data issue

What I did: Migrated entire pricing system from grams to pounds, updated product schema to use base_price_per_pound, modified order inquiry schema
What problem this solves: Aligns system with actual business operations where products are priced and sold by the pound

What I did: Implemented complete inventory content type with stock tracking fields (quantity, reorder points, batch numbers, expiration dates), created controllers, services, and routes
What problem this solves: Enables tracking of product stock levels, supports reorder alerts, and prevents overselling

What I did: Updated order inquiry lifecycles to use global Strapi instance, enhanced authentication middleware for better security
What problem this solves: Fixes issues with customer data population and ensures proper authentication on order endpoints

What I did: Added complete Traefik reverse proxy deployment configuration, created docker-compose.traefik.yml, environment templates, setup scripts, and comprehensive deployment documentation
What problem this solves: Enables production deployment on servers with existing Traefik infrastructure, allowing multiple apps to share one reverse proxy

What I did: Created centralized image utility functions (getImageUrl, getImageName, getImageAlt) to handle both ProductImage and Strapi wrapper formats, updated all components
What problem this solves: Eliminates duplicate image handling logic across components, fixes TypeScript errors with image.attributes?.url

What I did: Updated product categories and measurement units across frontend and backend, added inventory page to portal layout navigation
What problem this solves: Ensures consistency between frontend display and backend data structure

What I did: Updated LoginForm.tsx to check userType from auth store, created strapi-server.ts for JWT token customization to include userType field
What problem this solves: Fixes issue where admin users were incorrectly redirected to standard user dashboard instead of Admin Portal

What I did: Built admin-products.ts API module with comprehensive CRUD functions, developed product listing page with statistics dashboard, DataTable with sortable columns, search, pagination, and quick actions
What problem this solves: Before this, managing products required direct access to Strapi admin panel. Now non-technical staff can manage products directly

What I did: Implemented complete image upload handling with file validation, uploads to Strapi media library, progress display, and multiple image support per product
What problem this solves: Allows admins to manage product images directly alongside other product information

What I did: Built product detail/edit page with inline editing, inventory management section with adjustment controls. Built new product form with validation, category/tag dropdowns, image upload with drag-and-drop, and preview mode
What problem this solves: Removes need to switch to Strapi backend for viewing/editing products. Provides user-friendly interface for admins

What I did: Built complete user management section: admin-users.ts API module for user CRUD and order aggregation, user listing page with stats and quick actions, user detail page with order history and activity timeline
What problem this solves: No easy way existed to see reseller's complete history or manage account status. Now admin staff can handle account management immediately

What I did: Implemented notification system with popover.tsx component, notification bell with unread count badge, 30-second polling, mark as read functionality, and click-through navigation to relevant content
What problem this solves: Before this, admins had no way to know when important events happened without manually checking. Now important events are surfaced immediately

What I did: Integrated all new features, verified admin login routing, tested complete product management flow, validated user management operations, confirmed notification polling performance, fixed race condition and styling bugs
What problem this solves: Ensures features work together as a cohesive system and catches issues before QA
